intro: Ochlopoa notabilis, commonly known as the showy dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Ochlopoa notabilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
